title: Item Visually check tyres for wear, condition and proper inf…
caption_en: Item Visually check tyres for wear, condition and proper inflation. Inform maintenance crew if tyres are worn or damaged.

title: Item Visually check that wheel tie bolts are present in both…
caption_en: Item Visually check that wheel tie bolts are present in both the nose wheel and main wheels. Wheel replacement will be necessary if any is missing. The tie bolts hold the 2 wheel hubs together. Inform maintenance crew if any bolt is missing.

title: Item Check hydraulic systems quantities and service as requi…
caption_en: Item Check hydraulic systems quantities and service as required. Record uplift in Fuel and Oil log." During their exterior checks, crew are to ensure that only the FULL light is illuminated. This means that the reservoirs properly serviced to the correct level.

title: If the OVER full light is illuminated, this means that the r…
caption_en: If the OVER full light is illuminated, this means that the reservoir is over-serviced. Crew should inform the maintenance crew to drain off the excess fluid.

title: If the ADD light is illuminated, the fluid level is at the l…
caption_en: If the ADD light is illuminated, the fluid level is at the low ADD level. An advisory CAS message MAIN LO is also displayed. Maintenance action is required and the reservoir needs to be serviced.

title: To service the reservoir, open the or ground servicing panel…
caption_en: To service the reservoir, open the or ground servicing panel door. Next, depressurise the reservoir by removing the pneumatic cap from the hydraulic reservoir air bleed valve. Then, depress the bleed valve stem to allow the air pressure to bleed off.

title: Then, connect the hydraulic service cart hose to the reservo…
caption_en: Then, connect the hydraulic service cart hose to the reservoir fill coupling. Pump hydraulic fluid into the reservoir until the FULL indicator is illuminated.

title: To achieve a correct servicing, switch on the Auxiliary pump…
caption_en: To achieve a correct servicing, switch on the Auxiliary pump. The Brake accumulator pressure should indicate psi. After servicing, disconnect the pump hose and re-install the caps on the reservoir air bleed valve and the fill coupling. Then close the servicing panel door.

title: Record the hydraulic fluid uplift into the Fuel Qil log.
caption_en: Record the hydraulic fluid uplift into the Fuel Qil log.
